page.shortlink: api a5 group has permission function
page.description: Returns .T. if specified group has all permission to name/class, .F. otherwise
page.syntax: Result as C = a5_group_has_permission(C cGID ,C name ,C class ,C permission ,C default_mode )

argument.name: Result
argument.description: "Grant" = The group has been given the indicated permission to the object. "Deny" = The group was not given the indicated permission.

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the object and the data dictionary that contains it.

argument.name: class
argument.description: The type of object for which has the Permission. Valid values are:

item.name: Object Class (Filename Extension of Data Dictionary used in Name parameter)

argument.name: permission
argument.description: The permission that is being queried. Valid values are:

argument.name: default_mode
argument.description: Default permission to assign if explicit permission is not available. "Grant" "Deny"

page.discussion:
The A5_GROUP_HAS_PERMISSIONS() is an internal function that returns the permission to a class for a group. A5_HAS_PERMISSION()calls A5_Group_Has_Permission() for each group to determine the group's access rights.
You can get a group's Group_ID with the A5_Sec_Get_GID()function.
page.example: dim GID as C GID = A5_Sec_Get_GID("Sales", "mydb.alb") ? A5_Group_Has_Permission(GID, "myform", "form", "run", "deny") = "grant"
